security: Revealing the agency's assessments of agent qualities such as "personal courage, good security, and common sense" could provide adversaries with insights into agent selection criteria and operational methods, potentially compromising future recruitment and source handling. Also, the mention of helping Barker regain his American citizenship and recommending him as a leg-man could be seen as exploiting the agent for agency purposes, which could harm the CIA's reputation. Quote: "When the Station reopens I would certainly recommend that we continue to maintain contact with Sarker. If nothing else he would make a wonderful leg-man for the Chief of Station."
summary: An official routing slip containing descriptions of former CIA contacts and agents, assessing their qualities and potential future utility to the agency.
summary_one_paragraph: This document is a CIA official routing slip containing assessments of several former contacts and agents, including Adolfo SAN FELAYO, Ramon USATEGUI Lazara, Herbert L. Barker (AMCLATTER-1), and Manolo VEGA Abril. The memo details their backgrounds, skills, loyalty, and potential usefulness to the agency. It highlights SAN FELAYO as an ideal Latin American agent, USATEGUIâ€™s eagerness to maintain contact, Barker's extensive knowledge of Cuban personalities, and VEGA Abril's family connections. The document also mentions concerns about Barker's lack of discretion but suggests ways to leverage his strengths. Overall, the memo appears to be for background use in evaluating these individuals for possible future engagement.
title: Former Contacts
